paper_abstract: In this paper, we investigate the finite-time adaptive outer synchronization between two complex dynamical networks with nonidentical topological structures. We propose new adaptive controllers, with which we can synchronize two complex dynamical networks within finite time. Sufficient conditions for the finite-time adaptive outer synchronization are derived based on the finite-time stability theory. Finally, numerical examples are examined to demonstrate the effectiveness and feasibility of the theoretical results.
paper_title: FINITE-TIME ADAPTIVE OUTER SYNCHRONIZATION BETWEEN TWO COMPLEX DYNAMICAL NETWORKS WITH NONIDENTICAL TOPOLOGICAL STRUCTURES
